title: Senior Manager Regulatory Affairs - Americas
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. The Role
As part of the Regulatory team, you will work on all aspects of regulatory matters for Lilium in the United States and internationally, tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before.
The company is embarking on an entirely new concept, building an all-electric vertical take-off and landing jet, offering leading capacity, low noise, and high performance with zero operating emissions. Thus, the creation of new rules will be required for instance, regarding air operations, pilot licenses, airspace integration and infrastructure to mention a few areas. You will be creating and implementing our regulatory strategy, engaging with regulators and lawmakers in the US and around the globe and shaping the regulatory landscape for eVTOL jets and electric aviation overall. The role also encompasses monitoring and intelligence gathering of relevant policy developments at US, international and national levels, building a strategy to ensure Lilium’s interests are represented in new laws and regulations including drafting and defending policy papers, representing Lilium in trade associations and other forums and communicating our needs to elected officials and regulators.
The position reports to the Head of Public Affairs, Americas, is part of Lilium’s commercial team and will work closely with other members of the management.
Your Day to Day

Work across the organization to develop and implement our regulatory strategy
Manage and nurture relationships with key FAA officials and staff along with other national and international aviation regulators as well as other official bodies and stakeholders to work towards a progressive change in regulation
Represent Lilium’s interests in relevant trade associations and other interest representations
Conduct research, prepare high-level meetings, draft written submissions and statements
Develop regulatory proposals and manage rulemaking activities with various regulators
 Monitor political and regulatory activities in relevant jurisdictions

Your Profile

Significant work experience (5+ years) in the field of regulatory affairs with exposure to top-level decision makers
Significant experience in aviation and/or other passenger transportation. Work experience in aviation a clear plus
Top track record of effective regulatory adjustments
Experience working with elected officials
Strong academic background, especially in aviation law. A legal background and /or proven understanding of aviation law is a strong plus
MBA, strategy consulting, start-up, or other relevant business experience a plus
Fluent in English; additional substantial language skills a plus
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken and ability to explain complex regulatory issues in a clear and easy-to-understand way
Able to develop positive working relationships across different levels and functions
Able and comfortable working in a developing, fluid and constantly changing company, as well as handling multiple priorities while constantly meeting deadlines

Additional Information:

401k is not offered at this time
20 days vacation

US Bank holidays - New Year's Day, Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, President's Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Indigenous People’s Day, Veterans Day, Thanksgiving Day, Day after Thanksgiving, Christmas Day


Candidate must have the right to live and work legally in the USA (either GC or citizen)
Ideally based in the DC area working remotely / hybrid

 
#LI-SL1
 Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
